intro: Stigmaphyllon auriculatum, commonly known as the ear-shaped leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Stigmaphyllon auriculatum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, humid environments.
